page.title: 17Ludlow Hunt,Ashford C.
page.content: The Ludlow Hunt stables and kennels are situated between Ashford Carbonell and Caynham.The buildings were purpose -built in 1891 and hunt about a 10 mile radius of Ludlow,during the months between September and February on three days a week.The kennels are run by the kennel huntsman or "whipper-in" with a young boy to help and a stud groom.There are 57 couples of fox- hounds kept at the kennels,but they actually hunt with a pack of about 17 couples.The hounds are a mixture of English fox-hounds and Welsh fox-hounds.There are 8 horses kept at the stables which are for use by the Master and the "whipper-in".The Hunt is financed by a levy paid by the local farmers and various fund raising events.The Master also contributes financially to the running of the Hunt.
